user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_Console_CopyOut:
```c
static int32 OS_Console_CopyOut(OS_console_internal_record_t *console, const char *Str, size_t *NextWritePos)
{
    const char *pmsg;
    size_t      WriteOffset;
    int32       return_code;

    return_code = OS_ERROR;
    pmsg        = Str;
    WriteOffset = *NextWritePos;
    while (true)
    {
        if (*pmsg == 0)
        {
            /* String is complete */
            *NextWritePos = WriteOffset;
            return_code   = OS_SUCCESS;
            break;
        }
        console->BufBase[WriteOffset] = *pmsg;
        WriteOffset                   = WriteOffset + 1;
        if (WriteOffset >= console->BufSize)
        {
            WriteOffset = 0;
        }

        if (WriteOffset == console->ReadPos)
        {
            /* out of space */
            return_code = OS_QUEUE_FULL;
            break;
        }

        ++pmsg;
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
MISRA C:2023 Rule 21.17 specifically targets use of the Standard Library string functions from <string.h> (e.g. memcpy, strcpy, strlen, etc.) and requires that their use does not access beyond object bounds. The provided function OS_Console_CopyOut does not call any <string.h> functions. Therefore there are no code fragments invoking those functions to be investigated under Rule 21.17.

Note: the function does perform pointer dereference of Str via pmsg and writes into console->BufBase using an index. Those operations could be relevant to other MISRA rules (bounds checking, null-pointer use, or data-flow rules), and it would be appropriate for other reviewers to check that NextWritePos, console->BufSize, console->BufBase, console->ReadPos, and Str are valid and that Str is properly null-terminated by its producer. However, these concerns are outside the scope of Rule 21.17 because no <string.h> functions are used in this fragment.
